page.title: 04THE ELAN AQUEDUCT-CLEE HILL
page.content: The water pipe-line from Elan Valley to Birmingham runs through this area.{The Studley Tunnel}is one of the trouble spots. The tunnel is marked by concrete pillars, which were used as sighting points to keep it straight. They are known as{Monuments.}The tunnel was first opened in 1904. It is now badly in need of repair. Plans are being made to build a new tunnel. This summer, 1985, they are going to take samples of the ground. A new tunnel will possibly be built in the next 5 years. It will cost approximately 2\ million pounds. At the moment it is very difficult to repair the old tunnel because the water can only be cut off for 2 days. An agreement has been signed with{ {The Welsh Water Authority}that they will supply water to Birmingham for the next 99 years.
